title: How to Turn Smart Replies On or Off on Android

steps.title: Launch the Google “Messages” app on your device.
steps.content: Launch the Google “Messages” app on your device. It’s the blue icon with a white text box, typically found on the home screen or in the apps menu. [1] X Research source Update your app to the latest version. If you have not already done so, you can update your "Android Messages" app by visiting the Google Play Store on your device.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's in the upper-right corner. This displays the app menu.

steps.title: Tap Messages Settings.
steps.content: Tap Messages Settings . It's near the bottom of the app menu. It's next to an icon that resembles a gear.

steps.title: Tap Suggestions.
steps.content: Tap Suggestions . It's towards the bottom of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to "Smart Reply."
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to "Smart Reply." It's at the top of the suggestions menu. This will enable or disable Smart Reply. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Messages.
steps.content: Open Messages. Depending on which Galaxy phone you are using, it may have a blue icon with a white text box, a yellow icon with an outline of a textbox, or an icon resembling a yellow sheet of paper inside an envelope. [3] X Research source Update your app to the latest version. If you have not already done so, you can update your "Android Messages" app by visiting the Google Play Store on your device.

steps.title: Tap on ⋮ (More options).
steps.content: Tap on ⋮ (More options). It's the icon with three dots in the upper-right corner of your list of messages. The menu panel will pop up. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Quick responses.
steps.content: Tap on Quick responses . It's the fifth option in the Settings menu. This displays a list of quick responses that may be suggested during a chat. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap - next to a message you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap - next to a message you want to delete. This removes the message from your list of Quick Responses. You will not receive that message as a Quick Response suggestion.

steps.title: Enter a message at the top and tap + to add a response.
steps.content: Enter a message at the top and tap + to add a response. If you want to add a Quick Response suggestion of your own, type the Quick Response suggestion you want to add at the top and tap + to add the message. This adds the response to your list of Quick Response suggestions. [6] X Research source
